3sgte

How about a variation of another theme here. The hijacking has occured. Would you rather take your chances with the terrorist letting everyone go without incident, or would you like the possibility of ending the threat promptly?

post_info.post_title: You're aboard a hijacked plane, do you wish one of the passengers had a gun?

Shooterman

How about a variation of another theme here. The hijacking has occured. Would you rather take your chances with the terrorist letting everyone go without incident, or would you like the possibility of ending the threat promptly?

 
 That's a no-brainer. I trust anyone one other than the aforementioned terroist or hijacker. To place trust in the hands of one like that borders on imbecility. Thanks, but no thanks. I would prefer to have the gun, but nextbest is to have another passenger armed.
emclean
I would prefer a person who has recently trained with there weapon to my self. But lacking a option for a trained man with the gun on my flight, I would rather have the gun.
Tastyfish

Locked door sounds good to me.
 Are we assuming that the hijacker also has a gun? Or would otherwise it result in a duel with plastic forks and the purple thing left over from lunch?
 
 Trouble is this question leads to the next one- would you prefer to possibly have a passanger with a gun, a the hijacker almost certainly with one. Or neither having a gun?
Nature's Cry

Locked door sounds good to me.
 Are we assuming that the hijacker also has a gun? Or would otherwise it result in a duel with plastic forks and the purple thing left over from lunch?
 
 Trouble is this question leads to the next one- would you prefer to possibly have a passanger with a gun, a the hijacker almost certainly with one. Or neither having a gun?

 
 I think it would be best for neither one to have a gun, as there would be no chance of me getting hurt. After all, I could beat up a guy armed with a plastic fork. However, if the hijacker has a gun, I'd like someone (not me, I'm half blind in each eye, I'd probably hit a passanger or something) to have a gun.
emclean

"I think it would be best for neither one to have a gun,"
 wasn't an option, and that purple thins might be worce than a gun
Tastyfish

Yeah, but the question was loaded, if the results of this poll were actualy going to be used to make a descion in the real world that would be a more important question- everyone have guns, or no one.
 I would be slightly nervous of someone so paranoid that they risked taking a gun onto a plane just in case of a terrorist/hijacker. Either that or because he is a second hijacker but has a different destination in mind.
 But then I am thinking more of international flights from the UK were security is a lot stricter than internal flights so the risk in taking a gun on is a lot higher as is the chance of discovery.
Jeffersonian

"This started out as a documentary on gun violence in America, but the largest mass murder in our history was just committed--without the use of a single gun! Not a single bullet fired! No bomb was set off, no missile was fired, no weapon (i.e., a device that was solely and specifically manufactured to kill humans) was used. A boxcutter!--I can't stop thinking about this. A thousand gun control laws would not have prevented this massacre." - Michael Moore
 
 What does this mean? I don't speak Michael Moore, can an anti-gunner please translate?
emclean

I think it is his was of saying “o-sh!t, gun violence is not as topical as I would like right now, there might be less emotion for my arguments, and some one might look at the facts, and not my opinion”
JPSartre12

"This started out as a documentary on gun violence in America, but the largest mass murder in our history was just committed--without the use of a single gun! Not a single bullet fired! No bomb was set off, no missile was fired, no weapon (i.e., a device that was solely and specifically manufactured to kill humans) was used. A boxcutter!--I can't stop thinking about this. A thousand gun control laws would not have prevented this massacre." - Michael Moore
 
 What does this mean? I don't speak Michael Moore, can an anti-gunner please translate?

 
 Unfortunately, Michael Moore is a XXXXX. While a thousand gun control laws couldn't prevent 9-11, if there weren't ANY gun control laws, 9-11 would surely have been preventable. But, Michael Moore, being a XXXXX, would never be able to draw such a logical conclusion. It isn't "liberal" enough for his tastes.
 emoticon_xkill
Jeffersonian

I think it is his was of saying "o-sh!t, gun violence is not as topical as I would like right now, there might be less emotion for my arguments, and some one might look at the facts, and not my opinion"

 
 
 "I think....etc etc"
 
 Are you sure?
Tastyfish

You think you should be able to bring guns on to planes anyway, regardless of whether you think there could be a terrorist planning to use it as a living bomb. 9/11 happened because people did not think that they would do that, if they had guns and people did not think they were going to destroy the plane but just hijack it to go somewhere, I doubt they would risk the hijackers blowing up the plane (i.e the hijackers say that they are just 'conventionally hijacking the plane, but would blow it up if there is any resistance). Everyone having guns are equally useless as no one having guns, this is not the answer to this kind of thing.
Shooterman

You think you should be able to bring guns on to planes anyway, regardless of whether you think there could be a terrorist planning to use it as a living bomb. 9/11 happened because people did not think that they would do that, if they had guns and people did not think they were going to destroy the plane but just hijack it to go somewhere, I doubt they would risk the hijackers blowing up the plane (i.e the hijackers say that they are just 'conventionally hijacking the plane, but would blow it up if there is any resistance). Everyone having guns are equally useless as no one having guns, this is not the answer to this kind of thing.

 
 So, TastyFish, what would have been the answer on 9/11?
 emoticon_confused
Tastyfish

Give a warning to air crews that such an attack might be a possibility. It happenend because no one thought it was a possibility (or at least no one in a position to do anything was). You can't fight this kind of war reactively, you have to anticipate and look for possible weaknesses before they happen, another 9/11 style attack is very unlikely other than a small organisation copy catting it but those are less of a risk (less resources and experience). The big ones like al-quaida will be looking for a new method.
 
 The military plays wargames to find this kind of thing, where a general is given so many forces and told to invade, the police have criminal psychologists who can think in the minds of the criminals and predict what they would do next. The counter terrorist units need to be doing much more of this kind of stuff or so it seems.
Shooterman

Give a warning to air crews that such an attack might be a possibility. It happenend because no one thought it was a possibility (or at least no one in a position to do anything was). You can't fight this kind of war reactively, you have to anticipate and look for possible weaknesses before they happen, another 9/11 style attack is very unlikely other than a small organisation copy catting it but those are less of a risk (less resources and experience). The big ones like al-quaida will be looking for a new method.
 
 The military plays wargames to find this kind of thing, where a general is given so many forces and told to invade, the police have criminal psychologists who can think in the minds of the criminals and predict what they would do next. The counter terrorist units need to be doing much more of this kind of stuff or so it seems.

 
 Give the aircrews warning, eh? Now, guys, you may be attacked by men ( can't say swarthy, or in anyway, profile them as Muslims ) weilding box cutters, and trained to be airline pilots, that will attempt to takeover the aircraft and fly them into the World Trade Center towers. LOL! The giver of that warning would have been laughed at and drummed out of whatever orgaization, he/she happened to be working for.
Tastyfish

Then their superiors should get fired, it wasn't the first time an aircraft had been used as a missile, merely the first time a passanger plane had been chosen. I think that if the aircrews were told by someone from the CIA that there was a chance that there could now be suicide hijacking rather than merely the stealing a plane type it would have made a difference. What is the current procedure for dealing with armed hijacking, it wouldn't suprise me to find it was the same most banks have- go along with it and do as they say so people do not get hurt. If this is true it wouldn't until the last few minutes that anyone thought something different was going to happen (maybe not even that if the pilots were sent out of the cockpit seeing as the hijackers could fly). However if the possibility of a suicide hijacking existed then the policy could be changed to include a briefing of what to do in these circumstances.
Shooterman

Then their superiors should get fired, it wasn't the first time an aircraft had been used as a missile, merely the first time a passanger plane had been chosen. I think that if the aircrews were told by someone from the CIA that there was a chance that there could now be suicide hijacking rather than merely the stealing a plane type it would have made a difference. What is the current procedure for dealing with armed hijacking, it wouldn't suprise me to find it was the same most banks have- go along with it and do as they say so people do not get hurt. If this is true it wouldn't until the last few minutes that anyone thought something different was going to happen (maybe not even that if the pilots were sent out of the cockpit seeing as the hijackers could fly). However if the possibility of a suicide hijacking existed then the policy could be changed to include a briefing of what to do in these circumstances.

 
 C'mon, Tastyfish, you're grasping at straws, and more importantly, you know you are. Dead is dead. Given the choice of being flown into a towering building and being completely obliterated, or being possibly hit by a stray bullet fired by a fellow passenger or crewman, attempting to neutralize a suicide bent nut, what would your choice be? Even if knowing you would have to put down two or three passengers being used as shields, what would the answer be?
 
 Sorry, Tastyfish, one armed passenger or crewman aboard those planes, may have saved almost 3000 lives. Know something. I'll take my chances with the armed passenger or crewman.
Tastyfish

You totally missed the point, they did not know what was going to happen, they did not think they were going to die except that they probably would if they did not go along with what the hijackers said. If they knew what was going to happen then I doubt they would have needed guns to stop them (if they knew that to do nothing was certain death). Given the choice of trying to take on a terrorist with improvised weapons, or fight terrorists with real weapons, I would take the former knowing I was going to die if I did nothing. If it was just a gun thing then they could go from internation flights from countries with no guns, but it isn't. The 9/11 thing is a unique case, it is probably not going to happen again and they did not know what was happening at the time.
 
 I will admit that if I were on one of those planes and knew what was going to happen I would have liked to have a gun on my side, but as a general rule it isn't a good one in my opinion.
 
 Lets change the senario slightly, pre 9/11. If you had a gun with you smuggled on board, and you plane was taken over by armed hijackers. Would you fight them if you knew they were going to Cuba and live off stolen/drug money rather than crashing the plane. Would you risk you life then for a days inconvience? Maybe wait to see if they are going to take hostages or if they have no interest in the passengers of the plane at all.
Shooterman

You totally missed the point, they did not know what was going to happen, they did not think they were going to die except that they probably would if they did not go along with what the hijackers said. If they knew what was going to happen then I doubt they would have needed guns to stop them (if they knew that to do nothing was certain death). Given the choice of trying to take on a terrorist with improvised weapons, or fight terrorists with real weapons, I would take the former knowing I was going to die if I did nothing. If it was just a gun thing then they could go from internation flights from countries with no guns, but it isn't. The 9/11 thing is a unique case, it is probably not going to happen again and they did not know what was happening at the time.
 
 I will admit that if I were on one of those planes and knew what was going to happen I would have liked to have a gun on my side, but as a general rule it isn't a good one in my opinion.
 
 Lets change the senario slightly, pre 9/11. If you had a gun with you smuggled on board, and you plane was taken over by armed hijackers. Would you fight them if you knew they were going to Cuba and live off stolen/drug money rather than crashing the plane. Would you risk you life then for a days inconvience? Maybe wait to see if they are going to take hostages or if they have no interest in the passengers of the plane at all.

 
 I see two things that I believe as glaring. One; why should a law abiding citizen beforced to smuggle a firearm on board a plane? Two; Would you ever be willing to place your life in the 'maybe' good intentions of a criminal?
 
 Oh, and as an aside, remember the fourth plane on 9/11 that crashed because the people on board fought back, rather than chance the terroists crashing into another building, possibly the White House? 
 
 Sorry Tastyfish, I for one will never be content to place my faith in the good intentions of any criminal. To do so is paramount to suicide.
Tastyfish

Guns aren't allowed in all countries, you woudl still have to smuggle a weapon on board these, and guns are not allowed now. Seeing as we are saying would having a gun have stopped the 9/11 attacks you have to assume that you have smuggled one on.
 
 We don't know what happened to the fourth plane, the terrorists may have crashed it themselves rather than let the passengers regain control or attmepted to use it as a threat which backfired. Didn't they know what was gooing to happen, thought someone told them on a mobile phone. You have to compare this to normal hijacking not suicide planes.
 
 There is a difference between relying on the good intentions of a criminal and antagonising them. In most normal cases they will not want to harm you and it would put them at a big disadvantage if they do (if they are going to a country with no extradition the last thing they want to do is commit a crime there), however just as you are willing to defend your life if threatened so are they- and if they do kill you, you have put the rest of the passengers at much greater risk. Banks always tell the workers to always cooperate with robbers, in these kind of situations you put more people at risk by trying to stop them without the right resources and training than by waiting and cooperating. Suicide terrorism is a very special case.
Adept

Banks always tell the workers to always cooperate with robbers, in these kind of situations you put more people at risk by trying to stop them without the right resources and training than by waiting and cooperating. Suicide terrorism is a very special case.

 
 
 Hijacking planes at all is a very special case. Experienced and calm criminals just dont do it, as it is far too difficult to pull off. A plane will eventually run out of fuel, and once it lands you will lose and be killed/arrested by the police/special forces of the country in question. Smart criminals quickly realised it was far too risky.
 
 As a result, the only people who attempt plane hijackings are usually a little desperate, a little unhinged, inexperienced folks with a lack of foresight. Once placed under the pressure of controlling a plane full of hostages and negotiating with the pilot and people on the ground, these types of people begin to crack and become unstable. That is when accidents happen and people die.
 
 The other scenario is suicide hijacking ala 9/11. In either scenario the passengers are in deep trouble.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  You're aboard a hijacked plane, do you wish one of the passengers had a gun?
